results.title: Grimm's fairy tales. Volume 2
results.brief_description: Presented by Noni Hazelhurst, each of the Grimms fairy tales is brought to life by the use of beautifully illustrated full colour drawings of both the characters and their environment. The stories told in this volume are: Tom Thumb (16 minutes) ; Snowdrop/Snow White (16 minutes) ; Little Red Riding Hood (9 minutes); “Rumpelstiltskin (8 minutes). Each story has been divided into its own segment so the educator can easily find stories that suit individual teaching needs. This tape is not intended to be used for entertainment only.

results.title: Grimm's Fairy Tales
results.brief_description: Three classic stories that will stimulate young children’s imaginations with adventures of fantasy and fun. Join Hayley Mills as she leads you through these animated tales that include, “The Fisherman and His Wife”, “Tom Thumb”, “Seven With One Blow”, and “The Youth Who Wanted to Shiver”. Rated: G

results.title: Grim reaper. Parts 1 & 2
results.brief_description: In part 1, entitled “The True story” Professor John Dwyer of the University of New South Wales discusses the causes and effects of AIDS with a group of Year 10 to Year 12 students. In Part 2, “Education’s responsibilities” Professor Dwyer leads a discussion with a principal, teachers, health worker and school counsellor on the problems that may arise in schools because of AIDS education. An example of a successful school program is included.

results.title: Grim reaper = La Commare Secca
results.creator_credit: Antonio Cervi, Bernardo Bertolucci and Pier Pasolini
results.brief_description: Screenwriter Pier Paolo Pasolini’s tragic story delves into the underbelly of lowlife brute povery to create a fascinating tapestry of human behaviour. A prostitute is brutally killed in a Rome park, while offscreen police investigators interrogate as variety of male suspects, the events depicted on screen display their alibies from each individual perspective, however their narrations do not necessarily match their actions. In Italian with English subtitles.

results.title: Grill and oven cooking
results.brief_description: A comprehensive survey of all things dealing with the art of grilling and oven cooking of a variety of foods. Includes hints on cakes, pies and pastry. No 4 of a Cookery Series suitable for women’s groups and domestic-science classes.

results.title: Grievous bodily harm
results.creator_credit: International Film Management, Smiley Films, FGH Film Consortium, Australian Film Commission, Richard Brennan and Mark Joffe
results.brief_description: Made in 1988, this police drama delves into the world of prostitution, corruption and redemption. Journalist Tom Stewart (Colin Friels) investigates a robbery and the death of a woman (Joy Bell) who was married to Morris Martin (John Waters) an obsessive man with a means to murder. Detective Ray Birch (Bruno Lawrence) is also investigating the robbery but is keeping information from Tom. The drama unfolds as the threads of connection appear between the main protagonists and it is revealed the woman actually faked her death to escape Martin. Cast includes: Kim Gyngell, Sandy Gore, John Flaus, Kerry Armstrong and Austen Tayshus.

results.title: Grierson Lecture 1999: Screen literacy and cultural morality in the digital era
results.brief_description:
A record of the 1999 Grierson Lecture by Lord David Putnam entitled, `Screen Literacy and Cultural Morality in the Digital Era’.

Includes:

Introduction by Jenifer Hooks Executive Director Cinemedia;
Introduction by The Honourable Mary Delahunty MP Minister for the Arts;
The Grierson Lecture
Closing remarks by Jenifer Hooks Executive Director Cinemedia;

results.title: Grierson
results.brief_description: An affectionate tribute to Dr. John Grierson, father of documentary film, who founded and led the British documentary film movement in the 30’s and who later established the National Film Board of Canada. Reveals the drive and dynamism of this Scottish-born pioneer who through his faith in the drama of everyday life and his concept of the “creative interpretation of reality” influenced many young filmmakers in his own country and abroad. Many of them appear here to talk about the Grierson they knew. Using photographs, newsreels, interviews and excerpts from Grierson’s films this documentary brings into focus the personality of this visionary and committed filmmaker. (Awards: Toronto)

results.title: Grief, trauma and sexual abuse: the stories of two women
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Speaking from experience”.
Aimed at increasing awareness and consciousness of the crimes depicted, this episode from the “Speaking from experience” series looks at the experiences of Lucy and Tina. Lucy was sexually abused by her father as a young child; a situation that the remainder of her family was aware of. Tina was raped by an unknown assailant in her own home, a country property out of Melbourne. Both women speak candidly and honestly to varying degrees of detail about what happened to them, how they coped immediately afterwards and now, the impact it had on the rest of their family as well as intimate relationships, the benefits of talk therapy, the need for justice, and what has to be achieved to assist the healing process.
